data.title: Brad Koenig - Football
data.meta_description:
Brad Koenig (38) Linebacker  - Accolades
• First-team All-MAC (2018)

Career
• Finished his career with 298 tackles, 32.0 tackles for loss, 12.0 sacks, four
data.text:
Accolades

• First-team All-MAC (2018)

Career

• Finished his career with 298 tackles, 32.0 tackles for loss, 12.0 sacks, four interceptions, 13 pass break-ups, seven forced fumbles and four fumble recoveries.

2018: Played in and started all 12 games … finished the year with 101 tackles, 5.0 sacks, 10.0 tackles for loss, four forced fumbles and three interceptions … earned first team All-MAC … had a career-high 23 tackles at Army … was named MAC East Defensive Player of the Week three different times … had four tackles, one fumble recovery and two interceptions in a win at Akron … had 11 tackles, a sack and a forced fumble at Buffalo … had eight tackles and a forced fumble in a win versus Ohio.

2017: Played and started in all 12 games … led team with 103 tackles on the season … also had three sacks, a forced fumble, two fumble recoveries, three quarterback hurries, and five pass breakups … had 14 tackles and a forced fumble in season opener at Marshall … recorded a sack at Notre Dame … had 11 tackles and three tackles for loss at Kent State … had 13 tackles, including two for loss, and recovered a fumble against Eastern Michigan … recorded 11 tackles in win at Ball State … recipient of team’s Defensive Skill Player of the Year award.

2016: Played in 11 games, making five starts … finished season with 73 tackles, 8.5 tackles for loss, 3.0 sacks and one interception … had 11 tackles versus Mississippi State in the St. Petersburg Bowl … recorded his first career interception at Cincinnati … had nine tackles, one sack and a forced fumble in a win over Bowling Green.

2015: Played in 12 games, starting one ... made his first career start vs. Northern Illinois ... finished with 24 tackles and one sack ... also recorded 2.5 tackles for loss ... had a season-high eight tackles at UMass ... made a sack and forced a fumble against Eastern Michigan.

2014: Redshirted.

High School: Is a 2014 graduate of Ann Arbor Pioneer High School ... coached by Jari Brown... as a senior had 21 solo tackles, 11 tackles for loss, 3.5 sacks, and three forced fumbles ... was selected first-team All-SEC Red Conference, and is the only two-time winner of the William V. Ball Most Valuable Team Player Memorial Trophy.
